decks.notes: The main concept of this deck revolves around utilizing reanimator combos to bring powerful creatures back from the graveyard, such as Emperor of Bones and Archon of Cruelty. The deck includes a mix of spells and lands to efficiently discard and reanimate creatures, as well as disrupt opponents with counterspells and removal. By consistently bringing back threatening creatures, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and control the game in a 1 vs 1 Modern format.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through powerful artifacts and spells, while also ramping up mana quickly to play big threats like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Karn, the Great Creator. The Tron lands - Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine - allow for quick access to large amounts of mana, while cards like Expedition Map and Mind Stone help with consistency and mana acceleration. Tezzeret, Cruel Captain provides card advantage and synergy with artifacts, while Sire of Seven Deaths and Glaring Fleshraker offer strong creatures to end the game.

The deck focuses on using Allosaurus Rider and Neoform to quickly tutor and combo out powerful creatures like Griselbrand, Ghalta, and Atraxa, leveraging cards like Planar Genesis and Ureni, the Song Unending for additional value. The deck also includes various search and draw spells to ensure consistency and protect the combo with Pact of Negation. The strategy revolves around efficiently assembling the combo pieces and overwhelming the opponent with big threats that can quickly end the game.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game through countering spells, removing threats, and generating card advantage. The deck includes a variety of counterspells and removal spells such as Force of Negation, Spell Snare, Prismatic Ending, and Wrath of the Skies to control the board. Teferi, Time Raveler is used to slow down opponents, while cards like Consult the Star Charts and Tune the Narrative provide card advantage. Quantum Riddler and Solitude offer additional removal options. The mana base is focused on producing the necessary colors for control cards.

This deck aims to swarm the board with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu, supported by powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Leyline Binding. The key strategy is to maintain board presence and pressure the opponent early on, using cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Leyline of the Guildpact to maximize creature damage. The deck also includes some control elements like Stubborn Denial to protect its creatures. Overall, the deck focuses on fast and efficient creature-based aggression to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Amulet of Vigor and Primeval Titan to cheat out powerful lands like Urza's Saga and Gruul Turf. By using cards like Scapeshift and Summoner's Pact, the player can quickly find and play key pieces of their combo, such as Lotus Field and Mirrorpool, to create explosive turns and overwhelming board presence. The deck aims to outpace and out-maneuver the opponent using its unique land-based combo strategy, setting up powerful plays that can quickly win the game.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while attacking aggressively with creatures like Flickerwisp and Overlord of the Balemurk. It utilizes cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the opponent's resources and maintain board presence. The deck also has powerful combo potential with cards like Ephemerate and Quantum Riddler. The mana base allows for flexibility in casting spells and ensures a consistent stream of threats. Overall, the deck aims to pressure the opponent while disrupting their strategy to secure victory.

The main idea of this Modern Reanimator Combo deck is to quickly discard powerful creatures into the graveyard using cards like Faithless Looting and Thought Scour, then bring them back to the battlefield with Unearth and Persist. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Emperor of Bones, controlling the game with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. The deck also includes a variety of lands and spells to support the combo strategy and ensure efficient casting of spells.

The main focus of this deck is to take control of the game by assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate massive amounts of mana. With this mana, you can cast powerful Eldrazi creatures and Planeswalkers like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms to dominate the battlefield. Additionally, you have various spells and artifacts to disrupt your opponent's strategy and protect your own resources, making it difficult for them to regain control once you have established your dominance.

This deck aims to control the game through ramping up mana with the UrzaTron lands and using powerful Eldrazi creatures to dominate the battlefield. It utilizes cards like Expedition Map to search for lands, Thought-Knot Seer to disrupt the opponent's strategy, and Karn, the Great Creator to shut down opposing artifacts. The deck also includes removal spells like Dismember and All Is Dust to deal with threats. Overall, the key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and efficient control spells.

This deck is focused on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a large amount of colorless mana quickly. By utilizing powerful cards such as Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms, the deck aims to control the game state and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Sire of Seven Deaths to provide additional threats and disruption. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to control the game through powerful creatures and spells while leveraging the UrzaTron lands for mana advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to establish a strong board presence and control the game through the use of powerful Eldrazi creatures and artifacts. By utilizing the UrzaTron lands to generate massive amounts of mana, the deck can quickly cast intimidating threats such as Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms. The deck also features disruptive spells like Thought-Knot Seer and All Is Dust to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful creatures and spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing the UrzaTron lands to quickly ramp up mana and play powerful colorless threats like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms. It also features control elements such as Kozilek's Command and Glaring Fleshraker to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Tezzeret, Cruel Captain provides card advantage and works well with artifacts in the deck. The deck aims to control the game early on and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful threats in the mid to late game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by interacting with the opponent's plays through counterspells and removal spells. It also utilizes card draw and manipulation to ensure consistency in drawing the necessary answers and threats. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional ways to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to establish board presence with efficient creatures like Solitude and Subtlety while maintaining a strong defensive position with cards like Wrath of the Skies and Prismatic Ending. Overall, the deck seeks to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through careful decision-making and resource management.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes support cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Thraben Charm to buff creatures and disrupt opponent's strategies. The mana base is optimized with fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent casting of spells. Overall, this deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent and finish the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly deploy aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to deal damage early on. Supporting cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge provide additional reach to finish off opponents. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Static Prison and Thraben Charm to control the board and protect your creatures. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah serves as a powerful finisher, while cards like Guide of Souls and Ocelot Pride help maintain pressure on the opponent. Overall, the deck focuses on aggression and fast-paced gameplay to overwhelm opponents.
